sen.j: 未生流（みしょうりゅう）は、未生斎一甫を開祖とする華道の一派。
sen.e: "Misho-ryu" is a school of flower arrangement, founded by Ippo MISHOSAI.
Misho school is one of the schools of flower arrangement, founded by Ippo MISHOSAI.
Misho school is one of the schools of flower arrangement, founded by Ippo MISHOSAI.

sen.j: 西日本を中心に活動を行い、伝統的な華道一派として知られる。
sen.e: It is known as a traditional school of flower arrangement, with main activities in west Japan.
It is known as a traditional school of flower arrangement, with its activities based in west Japan.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: It is known as a traditional school of flower arrangement, with its activities based in west Japan.
Origin:
Origin
sen.cmt: コロンを削除しました。
sen.e: Origin

sen.j: 江戸時代後期の文化 (元号)4年（1807年）に未生斎一甫と未生斎広甫によって創設される。
sen.e: It was founded by Ippo MISHOSAI and Koho MISHOSAI in 1807 in the late Edo Period.
It was founded by Ippo MISHOSAI and Koho MISHOSAI in 1807 in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: period を小文字にしました。
sen.e: It was founded by Ippo MISHOSAI and Koho MISHOSAI in 1807 in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 創設された当時は町人文化が大いに発達した化政文化の時代であり、未生斎一甫が開いた未生流の元に沢山の弟子が集まり、未生流は発達した。
sen.e: It was during the age of Kasei Culture when culture of merchant class people flourished a lot, that Misho-ryu school was founded by Ippo MISHOSAI, attracted a lot of disciples and made a great progression.

It was during the age of Kasei Culture when the culture of merchant class people greatly flourished at the time of the school's establishment, and Misho school that was founded by Ippo MISHOSAI attracted many disciples and made a great progress.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: It was during the age of Kasei Culture when the culture of merchant class people greatly flourished at the time of the school's establishment, and Misho school that was founded by Ippo MISHOSAI attracted many disciples and made a great progress.

sen.j: 創設された場所は摂津国大阪（現大阪）である。
sen.e: The place of foundation was Osaka of Settsu Province (current Osaka).
The place of foundation was Osaka of Settsu Province (current Osaka).
The place of foundation was Osaka of Settsu Province (current Osaka).

sen.j: その後長い年月を経て、衰退した時期もあったが、関西地方を中心に活動を行い、西日本全体に「未生流」は知れ渡った。
sen.e: Subsequently for a long period of time, including some recessions, the school developed its activities mainly in the Kansai region and became popular over the Western part of Japan.
Subsequently for a long period of time, including some recessions, the 'Misho school' developed its activities mainly in the Kansai region and became popular over the western part of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を追加しました。
sen.e: Subsequently for a long period of time, including some recessions, the 'Misho school' developed its activities mainly in the Kansai region and became popular over the western part of Japan.

sen.j: 近代昭和の時代になると、戦前までは栄華を誇ったが、第二次世界大戦に巻き込まれ衰退。
sen.e: In the period of modern Showa, the school had boasted its prosperity before the World War II, but was then forced to decline during the wartime.
In the period of modern Showa, the school had boasted its prosperity before the World War II, but was then forced to decline during the wartime.
In the period of modern Showa, the school had boasted its prosperity before the World War II, but was then forced to decline during the wartime.

sen.j: 戦後にまた勢力を盛り返した。
sen.e: It regained its power after the World War II.
It regained its power after the World War II.
It regained its power after the World War II.
Philosophy:
Philosophy
sen.cmt: コロンを削除しました。
sen.e: Philosophy

sen.j: 未生流の創始者である未生斎一甫は、当初華道を行う中で、儒教・老荘思想・仏教の宗教的観念を根本的思想にした。
sen.e: During the initial stage of practicing the flower arrangement, Ippo MISHOSAI, founder of Misho-ryu school, formed a core of its basic philosophy associated with the religious concepts of Confucianism, Taoism and Buddhism.

During the initial stage of practicing the flower arrangement, Ippo MISHOSAI, the founder of Misho school, formed a core of its basic philosophy associated with the religious concepts of Confucianism, Taoism and Buddhism.

During the initial stage of practicing the flower arrangement, Ippo MISHOSAI, the founder of Misho school, formed a core of its basic philosophy associated with the religious concepts of Confucianism, Taoism and Buddhism.

sen.j: そして、華道をする事によって、自らの心を安定させるというのが思想として受け継がれている。
sen.e: And then, the philosophy was succeeded by later generations into the thought that people may tranquilize their minds by practicing the flower arrangement.
And then, the philosophy was succeeded by later generations into the thought that people may tranquilize their minds by practicing the flower arrangement.
And then, the philosophy was succeeded by later generations into the thought that people may tranquilize their minds by practicing the flower arrangement.
Technique:
Technique
sen.cmt: コロンを削除しました。
sen.e: Technique

sen.j: 未生流の華道技法には、直角二等辺三角形の形を象って華道をするという技法がある。
sen.e: One of techniques Misho-ryu school has adopted is to arrange flowers in the shape of an isosceles right triangle.
One of techniques Misho school has adopted is to arrange flowers in the shape of an isosceles right triangle.
One of techniques Misho school has adopted is to arrange flowers in the shape of an isosceles right triangle.

sen.j: そして、宗教観念を取り入れ、世界を形成する万物である「天地人」を意識した生け花が特徴的である。
sen.e: And the school is characterized by its own style of flower arrangement with intent to express a religious concept that the world is composed of "heaven, earth and human being."
And the school is characterized by its own style of flower arrangement with intent to express a religious concept that the world is composed of 'heaven, earth and human being.'
And the school is characterized by its own style of flower arrangement with intent to express a religious concept that the world is composed of 'heaven, earth and human being.'
